items.dataCustodian: Commonwealth of Australia (Australian Bureau of Statistics) 2011
items.name: ABS SEIFA IEO by SA1 2011

info.name: Licence
info.content: [Creative Commons Attribution 2.5 Australia (CC BY 2.5 AU)](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.5/au/)
info.name: Field Metadata
info.content:
Field used for choropleth map: decile
| title |description | | --- | --- | | sa1_code | Statistical Area Level 1 (SA1) code. | | ur_pop | Population counts in this column are based on place of usual residence, as reported on Census Night. | | score | A lower score indicates that an area is relatively disadvantaged compared to an area with a higher score. Scores should only be used in distributive analysis. To enable easy recognition of high and low scores, the SA1 index scores have been standardised to have a mean of 1000 and a standard deviation of 100 across all SA1s in Australia. However, this is not the case for the larger geographies which were constructed from the SA1 scores, such as SA2. Indexes at larger geographies were constructed using population weighted averages of the constituent SA1s. Refer to the 2013 Technical Paper for details. These geographies are Statistical Area 2 (SA2), Statistical Local Area (SLA), Postal Area (POA), State Suburb (SSC), and Local Government Area (LGA). | | rank | All areas are ordered from the lowest to highest score, then the area with the lowest score is given a rank of 1, the area with the second lowest score is given a rank of 2 and so on, up to the area with the highest score is given the highest rank. | | decile | All areas are ordered from lowest to highest score, the lowest 10% of areas are given a decile number of 1 and so on, up to the highest 10% of areas which are given a decile number of 10. This means that areas are divided up into ten groups, depending on their score. Decile 1 is the most disadvantaged relative to the other deciles. Note that deciles have equal number of areas, not people. | | percentile | All areas are ordered from lowest to highest score, the lowest 1% of areas are given a percentile number of 1 and so on, up to the highest 1% of areas which are given a percentile number of 100. This means that areas are divided up into one hundred groups, depending on their score. Percentile 1 is the most disadvantaged relative to the other percentiles. Note that percentiles have equal number of areas, not people. |

info.content: [Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International (CC BY-NC 4.0)](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc/4.0/)
info.name: Field Metadata
info.content:
Field used for choropleth map: gini_coefficient_synthetic_estimates
| title |description | | --- | --- | | sa2_main11 | Unique ID of SA2, 9 digit | | sa2_name11 | Name of the SA2 | | median_disposable_household_income_synthetic_estimates | Median Disposable Household Income (Synthetic data) | | gini_coefficient_synthetic_estimates | Gini Coefficient (Synthetic data) | | poverty_rate_synthetic_estimates | Poverty Rates (half median equivalised disposable household income as the poverty line) (Synthetic data) | | income_difficulties_access_money_synthetic_estimates | Proportion of people who had no access to emergency money (Synthetic data) | | income_difficulties_cant_afford_night_out__synthetic_estimates | Proportion of people who can't afford a night out once a fortnight (Synthetic Data) | | leaving_low_income_from_benefit__synthetic_estimates | The gross earning required for a family to reach a 60% of median household income threshold from benefits of last resort (State welfare payments or income support) (Synthetic Data) | | standardised_median_equivalised_household_income_synthetic_esti | Median Equivalised Household Income standardised to an Australian average (Synthetic Data) | | standardised_median_disposable_household_income_synthetic_estim | Median Disposable Household Income standardised to an Australian average (Synthetic Data) | | standardised_gini_coefficient_synthetic_estimates | Gini Coefficient standardised to an Australian average (Synthetic Data) | | standardised_poverty_rate_synthetic_estimates | Poverty Rate (half median equivalised disposable household income as the poverty line) standardised to an Australian average (Synthetic Data) | | standardised_income_difficulties_access_money_synthetic_estimat | Proportion of people who had no access to emergency money standardised to an Australian average (Synthetic Data) | | standardised_income_difficulties_cant_afford_night_out__synthet | Proportion of people who can't afford a night out once a fortnight standardised to an Australian average (Synthetic data) | | standardised_leaving_low_income_from_benefit__synthetic_estimat | The gross earning (expressed as a percentage of average full time earnings) required for a family to reach a 60% of median household income threshold from benefits of last resort (State welfare payments or income support) standardised to an Australian average (Synthetic data). | | median_equivalised_household_income_synthetic_estimates | Median Equivalised Disposable Household Income (Synthetic data) |
